Wings of War Airplane Packs provide miniatures for the Wings of War system. Each Airplane Pack includes one pre-painted, pre-assembled 1/144 scale model plane with gaming base, the relative airplane card and its deck of Maneuver cards. A Wings of War Deluxe set is also available.

Add a new dimension to Wings of War with Wings of War: Miniatures! The award-winning game mechanics of Wings of War remain unchanged in the Wings of War: Miniatures boxed sets: easy, fast, fun rules for re-creating aerial combat in the 20th Century. But now, beautifully painted and assembled 1/144 scale planes replace the plane cards for an enhanced visual experience and the joy of collectors and aviation fans! Each has a special playing base with all the information you need play Wings of War.

Wings of War: Miniatures is available in two formats: complete sets with 4 planes, maneuver cards, control boards; or single-plane blisters, each containing one 1/144 model plane, assembled and painted, and its deck of maneuver cards.

The boxed sets are an ideal introductory set or a gift, while previous owners of Wings of War may directly go and get the single- blisters to enhance their gaming experience and create a unique collection! The first series includes some of the most popular planes of WW1: the Fokker DR.I, the Sopwith Camel, the Albatros and the SPAD XIII, each in multiple versions with different color schemes.

Wings of Glory WWI planes are 100% compatible with Wings of War, using the same scale, base-fittings and pegs.

22511.description:
Prepare to step through the Gate! In the Stargate TCG, you'll guide a team of characters on journeys to other worlds, overcoming obstacles, defeating adversaries, and completing missions along the way. All the fun and adventure of the hit television series is here to enjoy!

As a trading card game, the Stargate TCG isn't limited to a single deck of cards that never changes. Hundreds of different available cards make for a huge variety of strategies, as you build your own decks from your personal collection.
22511.name: Stargate Trading Card Game

22513.name: Travel America
22513.description:
A Jacmar Electric Game for All Ages

TRAVEL AMERICA is equipped with 6 cards printed on both sides, each side containing 12 interesting illustrations and 12 descriptions.

The electric panel has 24 stations. Place the card selected for play on the 2 protruding panel guides at the top of the platform. Hold the selector tip in the left hand and place on the contact station selected for play. The other tip is help in the right hand and placed on contact stations until the lamp lights up. The electric panel is is operated on a 1.5 volt dry cell battery easily replaced. Interesting fascinating and educational for all ages.

22514.name: The Buccaneers: A Sea-Faring Game of Adventure
22514.description:
From the cover:
THE BUCCANEERS, a Seafaring Game of Adventure for 2 to 6 players, based on the popular TV program, is a game of strategy and skill that youngsters of 7 to 15 find absorbing get-together fun. The friendly rivalry of "Pirates" against "King's Men" offers the exciting competitive play recommended by child psychologists for growing-up years. Every game plays differently and is bound to capture the attention of even the most active children for a period of quieter play.

Planning moves on the action-packed "sea" board in order to capture the most "Buccaneer Treasure" develops mental concentration and encourages social responsiveness through the opportunity for team play. Ideal for an after-school get-together, family play hours and other recreational moments.

Ships move from their own Start Corner to their own Finish Corner by role of dice. Along the path if they land directly on a "Pick up Treasure" space, they may do so. Treasure chests are vary in value and the value remains secret until the game ends. If they land directly on one of their opponent's ship, they "Cannonade", taking off a mast from the opponent's ship. If all three masts are removed, the ship is sunk and any treasure it had goes to the other side. The game ends when all of the Treasure Chests have been sailed off the board or one side has all of its ships sunken. Winner has the greatest value from their treasure.

22515.name: Magic Words
22515.description: The game is played by teams of 2 players. The idea is to find 3-4 words crossing each other and set these words in a 5*5 grid as fast as possible. Winning of a round produces a point. The first team to gather 5 points wins.

22516.name: Snout! The Pass The Pigs Card Game
22516.description:
Snout! is the card game version of Pass the Pigs. The card deck contains 52 cards with depictions of the various pig dice landing positions and the points associated with them. Throw a pig dice and match the thrown position with the cards in your hand. As in Pass the Pigs the first player to reach 100 points is the winner.

From the box:
For 2 to 6 players ages 7 and up.

22517.name: Chicago Sports Trivia Game
22517.description:
Chicago Sports Trivia contains 2,020 questions on 505 cards in 4 categories: Chicago Cubs, Chicago White Sox, Chicago Bears and All Sports (which includes Bulls, Black Hawks, Sting and college sports).

Players attempt to correctly answer as many questions as possible to be the first player to reach the WINNER box.

22518.name: Laiva on lastattu
22518.description: This is a word game where there are 25 squares on the board and the idea is to fill them with colored tokens. The name of the game translates into English as 'The ship is loaded'.

22519.name: Hockey Night
22519.description: A trivia game about ice hockey published to promote Finnish ice hockey TV-program Hockey Night. There are 900 questions and answers included.

22521.name: L33T Tiles
22521.description:
L33T Tiles are a replacement tile set for Scrabble® and other word games, based on internet slang known as leetspeak. The letter distribution has been modified and extensively tested for optimal play using leet words in the add-on dictionary.

Each set of L33T Tiles comes with 103 tiles, a satin pouch and a manual with additional rules for gameplay. The tiles are colored to emulate a classic terminal window, and the manual is printed on a genuine IBM punch card.

Home Page: http://www.leettiles.com/

22523.description:
Your cook wants to deliver variable soups at first. Roll the die , move your cook around a Kalaha like board. Try to get the to the hotplates and if the right ingredients are there you can lay down one of your 9 cards with different soup recipes you get in the beginning of the game. The first one who completes all of his soups is the "Meisterkoch".

This game is a re-themed and redeveloped version of Auf Fotosafari in Ombagassi.
22523.name: Topfgucker

22524.description:
Collect carrots with your hare from the 'garden' and bring them back to the burrow (the starting point). Once there you receive a carrot card, but keeps it face down until the end of the game.

There are 3 kinds of carrots:

rotten (no points at the end of the game),
unripe green (1 point) and
ripe red carrots (2 points).




The player with the most points wins.

It is also possible to win and lose carrots during the game in the two next situations:

1. If a hare with a carrot and a hare without a carrot meet on the same square, they must roll the die to determine who keeps the carrot.

2. If you collect 3 lettuce cards (you get these when you are on a square with a lettuce symbol), you will win a carrot card from the player with the most cards.
22524.name: Carrot Race

22525.name: Schweine-Würfeln
22525.description: This is a mini-game in Bartl's range of match-box sized games and puzzles. The game is a simpler version of Pass the Pigs, where little pig figurines are cast and points are scored according to how they land. However, the main difference is that instead of two pigs, the game comes with five; and there is no 'jeopardy' element in the game. Players simply cast the pigs and take their score, then the next player takes their turn.

22526.name: Wizard Wars
22526.description:
Maug the Wizard-King is dead. You are one of his apprentices, skilled in the dark arts and in the arts of sorcery. Summon minions to fight your battles, wield earthshaking magics. Vie for control of ancient libraries, pools of magical power, and mighty fortresses. Then, when the time is right, take the Diamond Throne for your own!

Each apprentice has a different deck of spells available. These are not only thematic, but give different sorts of abilities. Wizards going on quests can find magic items. The Regent must be deposed from the throne first, then the throne held for three full turns to win. Meanwhile, the peasants will attack whoever currently holds the throne.

Game contains a rolled up laminated color board, player mats, and cardstock counters, tent-folded figures, a spell deck for each player, and monster and item cards.

22527.name: Gold Broker: Y2K Collectors Edition
22527.description: In this Monopoly-like game, players compete to be the first to double their net worth by rolling the dice and moving around a board buying properties and investing in gold. As in Monopoly, players have to pay each other rent when they land on owned properties, but this game focuses more on the fluctuating price of gold and takes advantage of the Y2K scare by including "Y2K Crash" spaces that cause money to be lost and "Computer Whiz" spaces where money is earned for fixing Y2K bugs.
